text: Has anyone tried doing a archive sidebar on a HubSpot blog before that lists past posts groups by there month? The only way I can think of doing this is with javascript. (but this will be heavy on the browser I’m sure)
feel like the post listing module might have that as a setting
I can output the recent posts that way, but im wondering if there would be someway to use `blog_recent_posts` to pull the feed, then in a loop group the posts by their months
yes, you can, but you’ll only be able to get the first 200 items, so some months will artificially show fewer posts than they really have
the way to do it is have an array for each month, loop through all of the posts adding them to that array then loop through each month to print the posts in that month
That what im thinking, and i guess ill just use the post listing module to print everything out and set the limit very high
I was actually meaning to use the blog_recent_posts for it
Oh my mistake, either way we probubly wont want to do a full archive list, I feel people never want to go back super far anyways
so a limit of 200 seems fine to me

this code I gave you yesterday you could modify to do what you want:

<https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C2YH119N2/p1539811021000100?thread_ts=1539703890.000100&cid=C2YH119N2>
Oh i totally missed this from yesterday opps
But yes this should help, thank you!
Actually, I just found there is a `{% post_filter "post_filter" %}` which should totally solve it
yes, that is much better. If you’re nesting loops, there’s probably a better way

I want to disabled a CTA (I don’t want to hide just disable click event) before checking a checkbox
Any ideas ?
